alert.note: Alert for Bryan (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 11 at 8:11PM EST until further notice by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Georgia, including the following counties, Bryan and Chatham. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 811 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pooler, Richmond Hill, Tybee Island, Coffee Bluff, Windsor Forest, Midtown Savannah, Hunter Army Airfield, Downtown Savannah, Hutchinson Island, Wilmington Island, I-16/I-95 Interchange, Savannah International Airport, Montgomery, Garden City, Port Wentworth, Thunderbolt, Vernonburg, White Bluff and Sandfly.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Heavy rain in Downtown Savannah will result in nuisance flooding of low-lying areas. Slow down when traveling and allow extra distance between you and the vehicle ahead. Do not drive into water of unknown depth.
